Reviews.Title: “Just Right in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea H
Reviews.Content: A friend recommend the Lindbergh for our recent trip to France. The location is beyond perfect. It's peacful and near many shops and eateries I felt quite safe walking around by myself to grab a coffee or bite to eat. The metro is nearby, as well. The staff is very attentive and helpful and treat you like family. Breakfast was a delcious and a great way to start the day. The hotel isn't grand, but it is just right. The room was clean and fairly large for Parisian standards. The hotel was exceptionally clean. I recommend it to all my friends visiting Paris. We hope to come back for another stay again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick C
Reviews.Content: I travel to France to get my new puppy from my breeder and since I had to travel with the TGV from Gare du Nord, I pick up an Hotel that was close to a subway station. Yes the Hotel is Not fresh and modern, but bed linings Are clean and breakfast coffee is truly excellent. Remember that you sleep in a bed, so what is mostly important is the bed! Having a puppy with me means some troubles ahead, but tanks to a friendly Hotel staff we both got a very nice stay. You can find some good pastry shop at walking distance and the Eiffel is 20 minutes walk. The neighbourhood is secure, so don't hesitate to take a walk at night. The Hotel is located in a location with private schools and boutiques all around but theres a lack of good restaurants nearby. Hey, you can always grab a sandwich and run a few subway stations for great restaurants options. Tanks again at Hotel Lindbergh Paris for all your help ! Patrick & Hola Roche (The French Spaniel)

Reviews.Title: “A jewel”
Reviews.Author: Bill151
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my girlfriend's birthday in May 2011. I knew from reviews and previous stays in Europe not to expext a "grand" hotel room like found in the US. However the room (321) was comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. Manuela, at the front desk, was an angel who made us first time visitors feel like return guests. She even offered to give my girlfriend some French lessons. The hotel is around the corner from the Metro, a short walk to the Seine and Orsay and conveniently located for exploring Paris. We only partook of breakfast on our last day before being picked up for the ride to the airport but even so it was nice. Most days consisted of a cafe creme and a pastry at Sips cafe around the corner. The wine shop next door, and it's owner Raphael, were an added surprise and convienience. If you want a taste of Paris and Parisian hospitality, this is the place too stay. If you want things to be like home you may want to go elsewhere but you will be missing a great experience. Thank you to the staff for a wonderful stay. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but small.”
Reviews.Author: Mads M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean, but a litle small. The elevator was claustrophobic, the rooms was clean, but small. No refrigerator or minibar at the room, no duvet/bed covers just a blanket. The view was awful. Star 2 hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to everyone at Hotel Lindbergh”
Reviews.Author: teacherCleveland
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Hotel Lindbergh with a group of high school students traveling to an exchange program. We stayed 3 nights in this hotel in St. Germain de Près. The rooms were sufficiently large to accomodate all their luggage comfortably, the bathrooms and rooms were spotless each day, the beds comfortable, and the location was quiet and very well situated. We love walking by the boutiques, antique stores, bakery shops and seeing the beautiful architecture or a hidden Pagoda on our way to see the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, the Musée d'Orsay, Notre Dame or St. Michel. We rarely take the metro but it is just around the corner. It is also well situated to walk to the RER to go to Versailles. It is obvious that the owners and the staff enjoy what they do. They welcome their guests personally, give advice and arrange taxi service to the train station with all of our luggage.. What a relief for me when I arrive after a long trip. I feel like I can relax knowing that for the next few days we will be comfortable and we can enjoy Paris.We will return next year. Merci à tous.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mihaela G
Reviews.Content: My husband, my teenage son and I spent 11 marvelous days in Paris this July. The room, on the second floor, was large enough for the three of us, quiet and clean. The bathroom was also large enough, fresh-looking and clean. Our window was facing a quiet court. The staff was very polite and always helpful. The best was that this hotel is within walking distance of almost all attractions (Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee d’Orsay; we even walked back at night from the Tour Eiffel). The neighborhood was lively yet safe. Le Bon Marche is around the corner and the best bakery (Poilane) is less than five minutes away. Great place, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Lindbergh Hotel for 4 nights. We found it to be clean and safe, reasonably priced and in a great location. The staff were professional, yet friendly and exceedingly helpful with all our questions and provided guidance regarding navigating around Paris. This was our first trip to Paris, and the next time we go, we will attempt to get a room at the Lindbergh. Our thanks to Sophie and Manuela and the young man who worked the late shift for all their assistance during our stay. I highly recommend the Lindbergh Hotel. Jim & Nancy Baltimore, MD, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMom23
Reviews.Content: My college age daughter and I spent 4 days here in late September. The room was small but clean. The bathroom was nice, with a large tub. The beds were not very comfortable (too hard).The front desk staff was very helpful and everyone spoke English. We were a short walk from everything -- the Seine, the Louvre, the Musee D'orsay, Blvd St. Germain, and many cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: SRLacson
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for the free hot chocolate! It is my favorite :) We are informed that the only room left was a twin but delighted to know upon our arrival that they took time to find us a double room. Perfect location as it is near to everything you'd want to see and do, it provides an array of coffee shops, restaurants, boutiques, tourist spots, not to mention it is very close to metro. People are warm and charming. Room is well maintained and clean and i love the bathroom. We are giving this hotel and the staffs a two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Cute budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: StefanVargyUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with my sister just for a night, as it was very cheap and quite central too. Hotel was basic, but had everything we needed. Pity was that our room was right next to lifts, and we could hear them all night. Also this hotel I believe is based close to train station, as whole room was literally shaking at times. This didn't spoil the experience, as hotel was nice and small, staff was very helpful and extremely friendly (not mentioning the front desk receptionist was really cute). I haven't experienced many nice people in Paris, most of them are really rude to be honest. But staff of of Hotel Lindbergh was really nice. Breakfast was priced 10 Euro, but breakfast dining room was really cozy, cute and very well decorated. I would probably not stay in Paris anymore, not because of this hotel, but because we simply didn't like Paris. Hotel is a good choice for one night stay, not too far from tube station, but please note if you arrive too late in the evening, you won't be able to grab anything to eat. There is apparently a McDonalds near by that we couldn't find, and we literally scanned all streets close to our hotel. Only store we found open before midnight was one just oposit our hotel (we felt silly after hour of searching) but note it is ridiculously overpriced. Basically everything there was priced Euro 3.95. Whether it was a bottle of still water or a mini-loaf of bread. Take food with you if you're planning to arrive in the evening. Undergrounds are extremely dirty and smelly, get ready for that too! Overall - I don't recommend Paris, unless you're staying in Disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Incredibly rude owner. Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Meredith78255
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 4 women for 4 nights in August 2011 and would have given this hotel a good review, despite a few issues. However, we had the most horrible encounter with an older man who claimed to be the brother of the owner. He was insulting beyond belief and absolutely refused to help us resolve an issue. The bathrooms smell like mold and body odor and the rooms are impossibly small and the ones that open to a courtyard shared by the adjoining apartment buildings are very loud. Do not stay here and spend your money on this establishment. There are other hotels in this area that do not treat their paying guests with such menace. Horrible experience to end an otherwise wonderful stay in France.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of distinct charm and affability.”
Reviews.Author: anacoco
Reviews.Content: We've stumbled on this hotel " by accident", and won the lottery. Located in one of Paris's most spectacular historical districts - the Saint Germain des Pres quarter, with the romantic lanes of the Luxembourg, the Notre Dame, and the immortal treasures of Musee Rodin and the Louvre in a 10 mins - half an hour ( at most) walk away. We were pleasantly suprised by its serene and captivating atomosphere, We immediately felt at home. Having visited Paris before, this was the first time when we thoroughly enjoyed the city, absorbed its vibe, living the experience to the full. We ascribe the success of our vacation to this wonderful hotel, where unlike, on previous occasions, we found the rare luxury of undisturbed all-night sleep. The staff was friendly and accomodative in a most sincere and touching way (and in Sophie's case - immaculately dressed, what as we all know, in Paris is the token of politeness).They did everything within their power to render our experience enjoyable, and we would certainly stay there again not singularily on one, but numerous occasions. The elevator, shower, television, e.t.c - all worked perfectly, our family room was spacious, bright and clean. Our teenage daughter who accompanied us on our trip ( mostly to visit her several Parisian friends), even returned to sleep at Lindbergh at 5 am in the morning, saying, " I planned a sleepover, but their ( typical Parisian) apartments are horrible! I want a good night's sleep." She also commented on the " intellectual profundity" of the young people she met " at the reception desk", so that's another plus. To put it short, this comfortable, affordable, and oustandingly located hotel, has left us with a beautiful impression, both in the emotional and physical sense of the term, and we've already recommended it to our friends. The only point on which we believe visitors might be dissapointed is that there's no breakfast included, unless payed for (10 euros). But considering the fact there's an impressive number of small restaurants around, grocery stores within a minute walk from the hotel in every thinkable direction, that should hardly pose a problem. Finally the Sevres Babylone Metro St. is just around the corner, although we hardly ever used it - nearly all of the attractions being in a walkable proximity. Sophie, Patrice, Manuela and the rest of the amazing team at Lindbergh - thanks SO MUCH for your hospitality, advice and smiles - until we meet again in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit was as good as the first - maybe better”
Reviews.Author: hopfrog
Reviews.Content: We were last here in 2005 and reviewed the Lindbergh on Tripadvisor at that time. We loved it then, but this time were pleasantly surprised that the rooms have been modernized and the bathroom, in particular, was much more comfortable. We again visited with our Boston Terrier, and he seemed to remember the place and the surroundings. The staff was lovely and accommodating, as before. We love the location as well as the hotel. We walked to the Louvre, Place Vendôme, Luxembourg, St. Germain, and had good Metro connections to everywhere else. There's good shopping and eating in the 'hood as well.

Reviews.Title: “Live the local life with the easy access to tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: FauchonFan
Reviews.Content: Situated among restaurants that lack English menus (there are a few clues) and shops that offer Parisian delights, I must say that our stay at the hotel Lindbergh was cordial and welcomed with a friendly staff and a very spacious room, compared to our past European hotel experiences. The staff was very accomodating with most being bilingual. Breakfast downstairs is small and quaint - a meal an American would find stereotypically European - with things croissants/breads, hot drinks, and fruit. Do not expect to have anything cold, just a heads up. The view outside is of the apartments of citizens so do not expect to see a gorgeous garden or view of the city. If you walk right outside, you'll have a fantastic city -street view. As for the area around the hotel, the metro, your large source of transportation, a very short walk away across the street. (Station: Sèvres-Babylon if you'd like to see the convenience of getting to other stations/locations) The RER is only a few stations away, your railway to Versailles. There are a few restaurants right by the hotel. Many are busy with a few over-the-top pricey restaurants strung among the popular cafès. Go to a cafè around lindbergh at least once, enjoy the true Parisian feel. Overall the hotel was of good value, with the spacious room making it worth it. The showers do not have water at high pressure though and the walls are paper thin. Fortunately the tubs are deep and the other tourists and overnighters are polite enough to understand to keep quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AlessiaC2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel Lindbergh is a small but chic 3 star hotel in a great location. Everybody at the reception was very nice and helpful, especially Manuela. Our room at the top floor was a bit small and dated but spotless with a view of the top of the Tour Eiffel. This is an old building with a very small lift so if you are travelling with more than one child and pushchair it`s a bit tight. Breakfast is simple. The decoration of the hall and breakfast area is very well done. The location is a chic residential area with lots of beautiful shops and small boutiques just round the corner (Le Bon Marche, Conranshop, Sentou, etc). Easy access to tube even if we prefered to walk as we had a pushchair. You can even hire a bycicle in front of the Le Bon Marche and visit Paris cycling. There is a very good restaurant in the same street called Le Botaniste. Please note that on Sunday most of the restaurants in the area are closed and there is no take aways in the neighborough. You can walk to the river in 15-20 minutes and 10 minutes to Jardins du Luxembourg.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic, very good location, its Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Drisanches
Reviews.Content: its a charmous place to stay in Paris and get all the paris atmosphere. great location, great rooms, i stayed there by honeymoon, it is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Off the tourist radar, "local" no frills hotel with English speaking staff.”
Reviews.Author: 1minnesotatraveller
Reviews.Content: A co-worker from Paris recommended Lindbergh Hotel to me. The hotel is not on the typical Paris tourist radar but my wife and I had a great experience. We walked from the hotel or took the bus anywhere we wanted to go in Paris. There was also a "Metro" Stop right around the corner. The front desk staff all spoke English and were helpful with suggestions on getting around and exploring Paris. It's not a 5 star hotel, but if you're looking for a clean, safe, no frills, and relatively inexpensive place to stay in Paris, Lindbergh Hotel is a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Started to love it but had an appallingly rude encounter with staff”
Reviews.Author: AlaskanRN
Reviews.Content: Nice little room, quiet and comfortable. Stayed here with my 23 year old daughter who had been living in France teaching school. I got up early and got us a tray of coffee, fruit and croissants which I brought to the room. She then went down to the basement dining area, sat down and ordered a second coffee. (Breakfast was about 8 euros pp) The "hostess" gave her a bad look and got the day manager who proceeded to berate her in front of the other guests for "expecting to get breakfast all day". It was awful. I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: geordy
Reviews.Content: Good price for exactly what was required..Double room, bathtub. Good area but for me a bit out of the way...if I wanted to enjoy the 6th..I'd stay more centrally there...for the 7th's attractions, restaurants, it is rather a boring walk...blocks of government buikdings,,not cute little shops, bistros, cafes, to get to more central areas of the 7th. Esp. troublesome in COLD weather. And for HOT weather I do not think they are air conditioned. But that being said...hotel was clean, comfortable, serviced well. For the complaints about the breakfast room..we did not partake..but it closed for renovations a couple of days before we left! So that will improve I'm sure. Didn't require anything of the hotel staff but all friendly upon coming and going. Arrived on the 29th of Dec. and was a bit disappointed they were not at all decorated for the Holidays... But a good stay, adequately heated, hot water, etc. Felt safe and comfortable. Used the extra blanket one night and then it was added to the make up of the bed. Used Amex at check out and was asked, "Don't you have a Visa?" Hello..you take Amex....not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: VBirin
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Very good hotel, quiet and clean for this price. Good hotel staff Minuses: Poor breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smithUtah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April 2009 and had a fantastic hotel experience. The hotel is family owned and operated and is one of the frienldliest places I have ever stayed. It is extremely clean, neat, quiet and the beds are very comfortable. The breakfast is one of the best I have had in Europe. The hotel is within walking distance to almost every major attraction in Paris; next to the Metro and fantastic shopping; sidewalk cafes and excellant restaurants. It is on a side street so not subject to heavy traffic, but is a half block from a major shopping street. We cannot say enough good things about this hotel and it's staff. We are definitely returning here on our next trip to Paris. Thank you Sophie and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ajb52
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Lindbergh Hotel arriving on New Year Eve having booked directly and efficiently with the management. The hotel is in a central location and it is a pleasant walk to many of the major attractions in the city. We had perfect weather for our stay which made all the difference. The reception area is small, functional, clean and welcoming. We had a bedroom on the third floor overlooking the street which was clean, warm and perfectly adequate for our needs. Despite being located just off the noisy main road we slept well in the large, surprisingly comfortable bed. The room was serviced every day. One day we returned to find the door unlocked which was disturbing. Breakfast is not included and there is a charge of 8 Euro per person. The breakfast room is located in the basement next to the the laundry room, the toilets and is dreary and in need of immediate refurbishment. The breakfast consists of coffee which is dreadful and of poor quality as is the hot chocolate. There is a choice of cereals, cheeses, orange juice, fresh fruit, one croissant and 2 slices of baguette with jam. Breakfast in local cafes was more expensive minus the cereals, fruit and cheeses but with better coffee. The breakfast staff are not the most friendly but then I did not find the reception staff particularly friendly either. There is a wonderful well stocked little supermarket just across the road with very friendly staff which I think is open 24 hours a day. Overall I would recommend the Lindbergh for a short stay for the convenience to the Metro, the shops and walking to nearby restaurants in the evening and would probably stay again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: DublinCallie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Was advertised as big room hence paying extra was in my opinion a small room. Carpets on stairs and in room very dirty. The room was drab ,old and in need of a total revamp as is the whole "hotel". Breakfast was priceless. The breakfast room was in the basement beside the toilet very basic. On the first morning the bread and croissant were handed to you only one each. I asked for a second croissant and was told no way unless you pay for it. talk about Oliver Twist asking for more. Anyway the second morning we arrived down for breakfast at 9.40 as breakfast ended at 10am. We were still having our breakfast at 10am finishing our coffee when the staff started cleaning up they literally started sweeping under the table we were sitting at and pulling off table cloths and making serious noise , then one of the staff looked at the clock it was 10.05 and told us we had to go breakfast was over. I have never experienced such rude behaviour from hotel staff and I have stayed in a few hotels over the years. Would not reccommend this "Hotel"at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky to Find the Lindbergh”
Reviews.Author: ShakespeareBeach
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Lindbergh 14 times since 1984...most recently in May, 2007. We love Paris so much that we have written a book about the City of Light that we'll be self-publishing. (We're not trying to promote the book..simply suggesting that we've had some experience with Paris.) And, believe it or not, what first comes to mind when we think of Paris is the Lindbergh. Our deep affection for Paris translates to a desire to stay in an authentically Parisian hotel. Nothing fancy or huge; but neat and clean, well-situated; and, most important, accommodating. That's the Lindbergh in a nutshell. It lacks only air conditioning, which could be a problem in the heat of the summer, but we no longer visit Paris in July or August because we can see loads of Americans in the U.S. for free. Owners Sophie and Patrice are so warm and welcoming that we consider them to be like family. The place has a distinctly French flavor despite the excellent English spoken by the hosts. We are totally in love with the area...notably the Café Sip around the corner, very nice nearby restaurants, excellent shopping, the park that features a little carousel and is an oasis of plants, proximity to the Métro, and a fairly nearby taxi station. It's about a 10-15 minute walk (and obviously a much shorter ride) to the Latin Quarter, the Seine, Musée d'Orsay (which we find to be an art mecca that is much more manageable than the Louvre), Notre Dame Cathedral, and all sorts of shops and boutiques. Paris for us is what we choose to make it. We love people-watching (from breakfast until il WAY after dinner), eating good French meals that offer acceptable value, shopping (mainly my wife), sitting and reading in parks, strolling by the Seine, cruising the Latin Quarter, and ogling street markets. The Lindbergh facilitates our enjoyment of all of the above, and it does so at excellent room rates. We also need to maintain contact by e-mail with our own small company in the U.S. while away, and the Lindbergh has proven very suitable for that. We like to stay in a room overlooking the street, and we try to stay high enough to avoid traffic noise (which isn't too bad because it's a side street). We find that courtyards anywhere in Paris have a tendency to retain noise and smoke. There is a school across the street, and the sounds of young children are apparent twice a weekday; but we really enjoy watching from our balcony as the cute kids parade by. We happen to enjoy breakfast (and people-watching) outdoors at the Café Sip (best croissants ever), but we've heard from a friend that the Lindbergh's breakfast is very good and an excellent value. By the way, our friend is permanently in a wheelchair, and the small elevator accommodates it. (But we'd advise anyone in a wheelchair to compare measurements of the chair and the elevator before booking.) If you want finery, a fawning staff, commercialism, extensive camera clicking, and plenty of fellow tourists, go elsewhere (like the Right Bank). If you want to experience the real Paris and a springboard to the little unplanned adventures that abound in Paris, consider the Lindbergh. And tell Sophie and Patrice that Sally and Richard send their best and can't wait for our next visit. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: sweet_avalanche
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights in Paris with my sister, and chose the Lindberg from the wonderful reviews you have posted. First of all this is a wonderful area to stay in. Really nice restaurants, boutiques, and easy access to the metro. But ....did not find this to be a very welcoming hotel. Could only call the staff COOL!!. We booked the hotel on the CHARMING HOTELS IN PARIS. Still wondering where thecharming element of this hotel is. Our room was very small, have stayed in bigger in Paris for the same money. The most disappointing thing was our beds were not made up on our 2nd day, but the towels had been changed, and bathroom freshened up. Would not really desire to go back, there are nicer hotels. Breakfast was average, but good coffee!!! A little gem we found before was THE NEW ORIENT HOTEL, near VILLIERS metro. This hotel is also near a fab street where there is an open air food market. The street is rue de LEVIS. A TRUE FRENCH EXPERIENCE!! and truly CHARMING!!

Reviews.Title: “Very sweet, great neighborhood, OK room”
Reviews.Author: jprae129
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lindbergh over xmas and, all in all it turned out extremely well. Paris is wildly expensive and it was great to have a (very!) reasonably priced room. We stayed in the quad room with our 2 daughters. On the downside...the room itself was a bit worn and small, but still perfectly adequate (the bathroom was nice sized and a very fresh yellow color!). On the upside...the hotel itsef was very pretty and charming (cute little lobby) , I think we were the only Americans (which I liked), the owners were very welcoming and extremely helpful, and the neighborhood and convenient location (proximity to metro and great areas) was excellent. Unless we can afford some really really super swank hotel, I am sure we would stay here again. The owners, the neighborhood, the convenience (did I mention the Maison du Chocolat and the Bon Marche are right around the corner), as well as an amazing rate for Paris, made this, for us, a great deal and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgensen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lindbergh in the week before Christmas and absolutely loved it. Location was great (smack in the middle of a lovely area) and the hotel very cozy and very French. I was there with my husband and two small children (aged one and two and a half) and we got a really spacious room on the fifth floor. The floors cracked (which I think is very cozy) and the room was clean. My sisters also were staying there with a kid each, and my parents, and we all were happy with our rooms - except maybe for the strong smell of smoking in one of the rooms. But hey, we were in France, what do you expect! The breakfast room was tiny, in the basement, but the food was nice. Good quality croissants, better than average coffee and fruits and yogurt and the like. Something for everyone. The service in the breakfast room was so and so. Some of the ladies were not too eager about all them kids making a bit of a mess, but that´s something you get used to in Paris... The staff in the reception was friendly, and helped with the restaurant selection (a bit hard to find a restaurant that you are comfortable to sit in with four young children...) and they pointed us towards a great one very close by where we got a room of our own (it was the oldest restaurant in Paris, I believe, but the name has escaped me) and wonderful food. We actually went there for two nights in a row, because it was just so handy with the kids. Also, I must mention that there is an elevator in the hotel, which helped us a lot in spite of the small size. And the tiny room in the lobby was very handy to keep our double buggy...which would have been difficult to carry all the way up to the fifth floor :) Overall, a very nice stay, for a reasonable price. Would definately go there again the next time I´ll be in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; great owners”
Reviews.Author: harpbook
Reviews.Content: With the strong Euro and a 2 week stay, we found ourselves priced out of the nearby K + K Cayre. After an exhaustive search, we settled on the Lindbergh, located around the block from Bon Marche and the Lutetia. We chose the hotel based on location and the fact that a room for three (1 double bed, one twin) was affordable (140 Euros a night). The hotel has several strong points, the most important of which is the friendliness of the staff, especially the owners, Patrice and Sophie. They treated us like family and were especially fond of our 6 year old daughter. When my daughter developed an ear infection in the middle of the night, the night manager (really a student) was able to arrange for a doctor to come to our room. In the end, the warm feeling of the owners and the staff more than compensated for the small complaints we had with the room. I know many people read these reviews, and since the Lindbergh was mentioned in the NYT and is in Frommers, I suspect there are several potential guests who know and love the area but, like us, are unable to afford hotels that are now 200-350 Euros a night. Here is what you can expect at the hotel. The lobby is very small. There is a sitting room off reception with a computer and a few sofas. It is perfectly comfortable, but has the feeling more of a living room or B&B than of a hotel. The rooms themselves are perfectly adequate, if you have low expectations. Our room, a triple, was big enough not to feel completely cramped. The main bed was comfortable, but the linens and blankets were subpar. (My wife bought a duvet to counteract the worn and unsavory blanket.) Cleanliness was also just adequate. The bathroom definitely needed a good scrubbing, and housekeeping was uneven at best. That said, when I asked for a new shower curtain (the old one stank), a replacement was promptly provided, and when I mentioned that perhaps the bedding be updated, the owners were happy that I had made the suggestion. We had a courtyard room, quiet except for the incessant low rumble of the metro. (One of the few perks of the transit strike we endured was not hearing the train.) If you can't hack the sound of the train, stay elsewhere... There is a small convenience store across the street with a colorful employee. At least I thought he was colorful - I think some women at the hotel found him less than pleasant. Breakfast was dreary in the basement room. I would pass... In sum, the Lindbergh is a good value in a great area run by legitimately friendly proprietors who care about their property and their guests. If you have low expectations, and you don't mind small rooms with bedding and some cleanliness issues, but that are nevertheless not without charm, you will not be frantically surfing the web looking for alternatives. It is not the Cayre or the Pont Royal, but you won't go wrong for the money. I think it would be nearly impossible to find something better in this neighborhood for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Isolation tank in 7th Arr.”
Reviews.Author: Pdellay
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a quiet, spacious and clean room and bath in a hotel at a reasonable price with friendly competent english speaking staff, well situated in the 7th Arr., is more difficult than trying to avoid the piles of dog crap lining Parisian sidewalks. Check out the Hotel Lindbergh on rue Chomel, just off Blvd Raspail (metro Babylone/ Sevres) and around the corner from the much more well known Hotel Lutetia in the 7th Arr., and, if it's available, room 54, with plenty of room for a queen size (or the french equivalent) and a single bed (including trundle), good size closets and clean modern bathroom. On the sixth floor, accessible by elevator (remember ground floor is not the first) and with modern french windows opening into a courtyard, this room was so quiet it was like floating in an isolation tank. And because of its location within the hotel, you are not likely to be bothered by other guests because the room does not immediately boarder another room. 100 euros includes breakfast and excellent wi-fi access. For an excellent bistro, try Le Gorille Blanc (the white gorilla) just a few doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: matinaparis
Reviews.Content: Our family have a short holiday in Paris at the beginning of Oct, 2007. We booked the room through the hotel directly. They offered us a quadrup room. The room is nice, quiet and clean. Room size is o.k. because anyway you will spend more time outdoor.The reception was also nice and good service mind. Though the elevator is tiny , but looked classic. The location is also very good because it 's just 1 min walk to the closed metro. On Sunday, just 3 mins walk there also a opened market, easy to find something to eat or just browsing. Cafes are around the hotel areas. A Grocery shop is opposit the hotel, this shop provide everything (yes, you perhaps find a spaceship in this shop :-) ) I would recommend this hotel for all seasons apart from summer because I'm not sure that there is an airconditioning in our room., see jsut the heater.Good quality small hotel with reasonable price!!

Reviews.Title: “great 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamcarol
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Lindbergh. Staff is exceptionally nice and helpful. The room was very large, a queen bed and a twin (with trundle underneath if needed). We were 3 people and we had a lot of room. Whole hotel was spotless, room cleaned promptly every day, fresh towels, toiletries, vacuumed. We slept late some days, arose early on others, room always cleaned promptly after we left. Large windows, no street noise, no real view but great sunlight. Weather was cool or room may have been warm, but at night if open windows and door for a few minutes it cooled off quickly. The breakfast (we ate 2x out of 9 nights) was excellent for 8 euros. Very good coffee/steamed milk, yoghurt, fresh fruit, cheese, bread, croissant, jam, cereal. All you want and very fresh. Internet access in lobby was also a plus. Hotel is one block from metro (2 lines) and one block from Bon Marche (great food hall). Easy shopping and cafe access within a few blocks. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location & value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RJ_LG
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel on a quiet residential street in one of the most ideal locations in Paris - at a junction of two enormously convenient Metro lines. Rooms facing the street are just perfect - floor-to-ceiling windows open over traditional iron railings to overlook the street below. Amenities are excellent for a hotel at this price range - comfortable & large rooms & bathrooms, toiletries, towels, etc. Hospitality is also great and it is clear the owners, who are on site a great deal of the time, are personally invested in the property. Staff are polite and accommodating, although they do not speak English particularly well and definitely respond to written / spoken communication much better in French than English - only fair since the hotel is in Paris. We found the hotel ran a bit warm, even in the relatively cool weather (20-25 C) during which we visited - I can see other reviewers' concerns about midsummer visits. I would also suggest requesting a room on one of the higher floors (we stayed on the 1st floor) to minimize road noise, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location, Nice Price, Nice Choice”
Reviews.Author: roomwithaview22
Reviews.Content: Requested and received room 61 - top floor with a small balcony and a peek-a-boo view of the Eiffel Tower. Rooms and bathrooms are small, but spotless. Free internet access (with your own wireless enabled computer) in the lobby is a perk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for real lovers of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Charente
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were originally recommended this hotel by friends who regularly travel to Paris and now always stay at the Lindbergh. Since then we have ourselves stayed there on 5 separate occasions over the past three years and have found it excellent. The location is great, the staff are warm and very helpful and the value is good. Having now retired and no longer on an expense account the days of staying at the George V, Prince de Gaulle or the Ritz are long gone but the Lindbergh is a great substitute and a lot more friendly

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Mini Break Location”
Reviews.Author: Molly Bloom
Reviews.Content: Spent three days in Paris with my sister at the end of August. it was a return visit for both of us and I booked the Hotel Lindbergh as I prefer smaller hotels to the large chain hotels. The staff were very welcoming and we were able to avail of our room at 10.30am following an early morning flight even though the official check in time was 2.30pm. While small, the twin room was spotlessly clean. It was at the back of the building looking out on a courtyard which was slightly dull but this impression may have been coloured by the rain which fell for two of the three days we were there. However, this did not spoil our enjoyment .The hotel is located in a quiet side street just off Boulevard Raspail. It is very accessable by Metro and is a pleasant 15 minute walk from the major attractions such as the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. A ten minute walk in the opposite direction will bring you to the St. Germain Des Pres area which is a lively, attractive area to visit by day or by night. It has many cafes and restaurants and while very popular with visitors gives the feeling of the Parisien Cafe Society. The hotel served a very satisfactory breakfast which included fruit juice, fresh fruit, choice of cereals, croissants and fresh baguette each morning. This was included in the web price we paid. We felt we got very good value for money as the three nights accomodation with breakfast cost 210 euro for both of us.The only downside was the tea at breakfast. The coffee was fine but as usual with continental hotels they do not understand the need for freshly boiled water to make good tea!! Stick to the coffee and you'll have a great base here from which to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: cwanderseattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a total of 5 nights (with another five in the middle that we were out in the countryside). We chose it originally because it was across Blvd. Raspail from our son's homestay apt. (right in the St. Germain district, he was the envy of all the other students for having such a great location). And that indeed, is the number one plus for this hotel - a fantastic location. We loved looking around the backstreets and shops nearby. It is right around the corner from a Metro stop, and really you can walk to (or at least we did) many places. We found the people at the desk to be friendly and helpful, speaking at least a little English. We discovered that we needed to change dates on the second part of the stay, and they allowed us to do so without penalty, although they had almost a month warning, and presumably weren't fully booked for those days. I booked over the internet originally, and tried to get the 116 Euro special, but was only able to book at 136 Euros. The room was small, and simply furnished, but very clean and efficient. We were there in June, and although it wasn't a heat wave, did need to keep windows open for air. There was some street noise, but not enough to be a problem. Also, it was helpful to have a computer in the lobby. We did not try the breakfasts, but sampled the pastries at the nearby cafe instead, since it was no more expensive. Overall, this was a great home-away-from home while exploring Paris.

Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are there at 17. to 19. 06 2006 We are from Germany and we loking bevore a another Hotell Near of them Lindberg,but this hotel is full ,so we try to go in the lindberg. The first : we dont have a Kart abouth the Kost for the Room, No Photo s from thes plaise. The Brekferst was a Drama The room is a suttering room whit 15 mq and a taibel whit foot ,you kant imagen i tell you a drama the full 2 days,Dont drink bear in a beer before you now the prise : i payd for a beer 8€ i tell you Your Paris dont see me 10 jears agow . Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel situated in what I think is the best area of Paris. Close to all necessary amenities and a pleasant walk to many of the main tourist attractions. We felt completely safe walking around the area, even late at night. Rooms on lower floors can be a little noisy, but we didnt mind all that much. Afterall, we were in Paris! The rooms are small and the bathrooms a little cosy if two people want to use it at the same time, but again, we were so pleased with its location, we couldn't have been happier. The staff were lovely and made our first trip to Paris such a wondeful experience. They all spoke adequate English and as we didnt speak French, we found them to be very pleasant and extremely patient and helpful. We will definitely stay here again. Note: If you are travelling with suitcases, metro stations do not have lifts and most dont have escalators so you will need to carry these by hand (and let me assure you that there are plenty of steps!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Lindbergh and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: hopfrog
Reviews.Content: We stayed about 8 days in early September, 2005. We had a room facing the street and kept the windows open, since the weather was warm. In contrast to the previous reviewer, we found it very quiet, except for weekdays early morning, when garbage is collected. The location on a small side street helps. Like most of the other reviewers, we found the rooms clean and small, but adequate. We thought the prices quite reasonable. We learned about the place from a friend of ours who lives in the south of France and stays at the Lindbergh when she comes to Paris. Since we were travelling with our Boston Terrier, the fact that it is dog-friendly was important to us. Most of the staff speaks a bit of English; they're not all fluent, but they try. I was more interested in practicing my French, though, and they were equally forgiving of my efforts. :-) Finally, their cafe and restaurant recommendations were excellent. We'll definitely stay there again. P.S. Since we were more interested in exploring the local cafes, we didn't try the breakfast. The Cafe at the foot of the Rue Chomel was actually one of the better ones we found.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rektikano
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a perfectly fine, fairly typical Parisian hotel. The rooms are small but nicely furnished and clean. Location is good for St Germain and Cherche-Midi. The main gripe is that if you stay here at a warm time of the year, and you need to open your window (there is no air conditioning), the traffic noise from Boulevard Raspail is a problem. Ask for a room facing the courtyard; if you can't get it, go elsewhere, or bring your earplugs!
